result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle M. Twilley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle M. Twilley

records.addlTxt:
11:23 AM Cases called: 20CT320, 21CF399 & 22CM586. Defendant Michelle M. Twilley in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Michelle M. Twilley.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
21CF399: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas.
The parties have an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to an amended Count 1 in 21CF399 Misd Theft of moveable property and Count 1 in 22CM586: Misd Retail Theft without the repeater. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders:
court costs and DNA sample and surcharges on each count

Anything else including 20CT320 and uncharged DA case 22EC2114 were ordered dismissed and read in.
Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Conditions:
No contact with any Festival Foods.

Conditions:
No contact with any Festival Foods.

9:28 AM cases 20CT320, 21CF399, 22CM586 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle M. Twilley in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Michelle M. Twilley. Defense waives reading of the complaint. 
In 21CF399: Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
All files are referred to Branch 4 to schedule

(11:51 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michelle M. Twilley does not appear in court or via Zoom.
State notes the defendant has other open pending cases and requests this be scheduled for same date and time as the other cases.
Court orders this case will be scheduled to appear at same date and time as defendant's other pending cases.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
